solution.text:
Let PR be the rope and PQ be the pole as shown in figure.
Also, PQ = height of pole = _{{4*i}}_ m
And, QR = base distance = _{{3*i}}_ m
From Pythagoras Theorem, we have :
\( PQ^2 + QR^2 = PR^2\)
\( PR^2 = (_{{4*i}}_)^2 + (_{{3*i}}_)^2\)
\( PR^2 = _{{pow((4*i),2)}}_ + _{{pow((3*i),2)}}_\)
\( PR^2 = _{{pow((4*i),2)+pow((3*i),2)}}_\)
\( PR = \sqrt {_{{pow((4*i),2)+pow((3*i),2)}}_}\)
\( PR = _{{5*i}}_\)

content.text: One end of a rope is tied at the top of a pole and other end at _{{3*i}}_ m away from the bottom of the pole on the ground to provide stability to the pole.If the height of the pole is _{{4*i}}_ m and it is making an angle of 90 degrees with the ground. Find the minimum length of the rope required.
